detaileddescription.para: Updating DaytimeRunningLight property.

Modifiaction reason and state are calculated. Last valid and latest received data are compared. If data changed, new data is provided via RTE interface and status message is send via BAP interface. Invoked in: bapi_updateAllStatuses bapi_updateKl15Statuses el_update_fahrzeuggeschwindigkeit_max
N/A
N/A

SWR_ICAS1_L3_BAPH_Extlight_1140
Check if specific value is in certain range.

This function check if specific value is in certain range defined by min and max value. Invoked in: ExteriorLight_BapIndication_ComingHome ExteriorLight_BapIndication_LeavingHome ExteriorLight_BapIndication_LightSensitivity ExteriorLight_BapIndication_Motorwayblinking ExteriorLight_BapIndication_HeadlightRange ExteriorLight_BapIndication_ManualActivation_CHO ExteriorLight_BapIndication_AnimationRearLight ExteriorLight_BapIndication_AnimationTurnLight ExteriorLight_BapIndication_LightSignatures
reentrant: No context: task context thread safe: No - Integration must ensure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
N/A
N/A
uint8
value - the value to be check if is in specified range [in] uint8 min - the minimal value in range [in] uint8 max - the maximal value in range
boolean TRUE - specified value is in specified range FALSE - specified value is out of specified range
Globals
N/A
Input->Output-Correlation
This function doesn't interact with global variables. It has no side effects.
Call Sequence
Test Method
SWATT unit tests. The testing method is described in: TEST_bapi_valueInRange
Traceability
This function satisfies any DOORS Requirements.

This file contain callback functions including BAP Indications, BAP Acknowledges and BAP Indication Errors as well as Update_Statuses functions responsible for updating values of properties, providing them to ExteriorLight module via RTE interface and send proper status message via BAP interface.
